Description: Terracotta reclining ithyphallic figure. A naked man, modelled in the round, reclining on a low sub-rectangular plinth, with his legs extending to his right, the left leg on the ground, the right knee raised. He has a large pot in the crook of his left arm, the mouth angled forward, and holds his gigantic phallus with his outstretched right hand, its glans rising up at least as high as the top of his (lost) head. Solid; probably from a two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt with a grey core, with substantial remains of an overall white dressing, painted pink on the flesh and red in the background gaps between the body, limbs and phallus.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3216)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Augustus Wollaston Franks
